body:
Does it work with other iOS versions?
Does it work if you include stdint.h before whatever include gives you that error?

Unfortunetely I only have 5.0 and 5.1, I've tried them both using those lines.  

The errors are coming from what looks like iOS SDK files, so Im not able to change them to include the header.  I posted here because I thought you may have understood what libraries I was missing.
I don't code on iOS I'm afraid, but will leave this open in case anyone has any info regarding this or if you figure it out yourself.
I will look into this and report back. Hopefully soon!
@zmanfx That would be great!  Im looking forward to ditching Xcode.
I am seeing similar errors with both 5.1 and 4.3.
@wprater unfortunately, I couldn't find any method to fix it. if you're just looking to ditch Xcode you could try JetBrain's AppCode. it's a java app but at least it doesn't crash every hour...
Is there a minimal source code sample somewhere that demonstrates this problem?
@quarnster I may be able to get you a sample if I get around to it today

Just a sample tab based app gives me the errors described above:
https://github.com/wprater/sublimeclang-ios-errors

Note that Im using the config supplied above as well.

Hmm, I don't see this happening with this project (10.6.8, iOS SDK 4.3). Does the error show up for you in all of the ".m" files or just one specific? Are there any more details as to which file included OSByteOrder.h or is the complete error message what's in the original post?

What settings are you using for SublimeClang?  Im using SDK 5.1

Here is the error again:
    /Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Platforms/iPhoneSimulator.platform/Developer/SDKs/iPhoneSimulator5.1.sdk/usr/include/inttypes.h:260,10 - Error - unknown type name 'intmax_t'

It seems to do it with every iOS main file I've tried.

I've been using:

```
u'-I/usr/lib/clang/3.0/include/',
u'-I/usr/lib/clang/2.1/include/',
u'-I/usr/lib/gcc/i686-apple-darwin10/4.2.1/include/',
u'-I/usr/lib/gcc/i686-apple-darwin11/4.2.1/include/',
u'-isysroot',
u'/Developer/Platforms/iPhoneSimulator.platform/Developer/SDKs/iPhoneSimulator4.3.sdk',
u'-D__IPHONE_OS_VERSION_MIN_REQUIRED=40300',
```

I'll upgrade to Lion (it's about time for that now) and see if I can get what you're seeing with SDK 5.1 later today if time allows.

Hmm, it's working fine for me on Lion with SDK 5.1. Here are the settings I used:

```
        "-I/Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Platforms/iPhoneSimulator.platform/Developer/usr/llvm-gcc-4.2/lib/gcc/i686-apple-darwin11/4.2.1/include/",
        "-isysroot",
        "/Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Platforms/iPhoneSimulator.platform/Developer/SDKs/iPhoneSimulator5.1.sdk/",
        "-D__IPHONE_OS_VERSION_MIN_REQUIRED=50100"
```

XCode was downloaded and installed via the App Store.
What does passing 'll' to the assembler do, with this line ```"-Wall"```

Im my main project Im getting more errors, however.  Like these

    /Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Platforms/iPhoneSimulator.platform/Developer/SDKs/iPhoneSimulator5.1.sdk  /System/Library/Frameworks/Foundation.framework/Headers/NSObjCRuntime.h:311,1 - Error - expected unqualified-id
    /Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Platforms/iPhoneSimulator.platform/Developer/SDKs/iPhoneSimulator5.1.sdk/System/Library/Frameworks/Foundation.framework/Headers/NSObjCRuntime.h:313,19 - Error - unknown type name 'NSString'
    /Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Platforms/iPhoneSimulator.platform/Developer/SDKs/iPhoneSimulator5.1.sdk/System/Library/Frameworks/Foundation.framework/Headers/NSObjCRuntime.h:314,44 - Error - use of undeclared identifier 'NSString'
    /Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Platforms/iPhoneSimulator.platform/Developer/SDKs/iPhoneSimulator5.1.sdk/System/Library/Frameworks/Foundation.framework/Headers/NSObjCRuntime.h:314,54 - Error - use of undeclared identifier 'aSelectorName'

-Wall means "enable all warnings".


Edit: Actually I guess what you want to do is to when in the .h file, select the menu item View->Syntax->Open All With Current Extension As...->Objective-C->Objective-C++. Then you  get the proper syntax highlighting also.


(Old suggestion: Try setting the option "add_language_option" in your SublimeClang User settings to false, and adding "-ObjC++" at the end of the include directory list to force everything being compiled as Objective-C++.)

Thanks, that syntax highlighting tip was nice!

Things are better now!  Trying to setup my project classes now.  I have some lines like such

    #import <RestKit/RestKit.h>

And they are in <project_dir>/Vendor/RestKit/Code , however, if I add that include line, I still get the error

    /Users/wprater/Dropbox/Development/.../ZapdManagedObject.h:9,9 - Fatal - 'RestKit/RestKit.h' file not found


Looks like I found some more headers in my DerivedData directory for RestKit.  But Im getting more errors.  I don't know enough about the clang compiler yet to figure out where and how to fix these types of issues.

    /Users/wprater/Library/Developer/Xcode/DerivedData/Zapd-eiwtqujvgquwkkganmtbxjdbuwfh/Build/Headers/RestKit/RKURL.h:44,20 - Error - cannot find interface declaration for 'NSURL', superclass of 'RKURL'

I have pretty much not touched Objective-C code at all, so I'm afraid I'm not going to be able to give much more help personally. I'd presume that you should compile and install any external library dependencies as is common with C/C++ libraries to get it to work as the source distribution might not be set up with headers and libraries in the correct path until you do the required compilation and installation steps. As to how to do that you're left on your own unless someone else knows the details and can chime in.

I've got this working, except for that I cannot seem to include the .pch file. Any idea what param I need to get that working? With regard to RestKit, it got happy when I included the RestKit/Build directory.

For whatever reason, I was able to workaround this issue by changing the line 
`"-I/usr/lib/clang/3.1/include/"` 
to read 
`"-I/usr/lib/clang/3.1/include/**"`

Hello

Did any one succeeded to solve this issue? I am new at Sublime Text 2, and I have the same issue when I enable sublime clang.

Thanks in advance,
Jacques
Only partially, with the help of the comments above.

I've detailed my fix for it here: http://b.rthr.me/wp/?p=368
This works on mountain lion as well, it seems. This makes the autocomplete work just fine for me. Maybe it'll help everyone else too.
@arthurlockman, You probably shouldn't edit the Default settings as it can be overwritten on an upgrade of the package. It's better to edit the User settings which will remain unmodified.
@quarnster Whoops, sorry. I'm new to ST plugins.
Closing old issue.

@wprater How did you fix this issue?

```
/Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Platforms/iPhoneSimulator.platform/Developer/SDKs/iPhoneSimulator5.0.sdk/System/Library/Frameworks/CoreFoundation.framework/Headers/CoreFoundation.h:92,10 - Fatal - 'CoreFoundation/CFUserNotification.h' file not found
```

I don't recall, but I do not seem to have the issue anymore after upgrade iOS, sublimeclang, etc.

On Oct 5, 2012, at 8:52 AM, Eric <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> @wprater How did you fix this issue?
> 
> /Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Platforms/iPhoneSimulator.platform/Developer/SDKs/iPhoneSimulator5.0.sdk/System/Library/Frameworks/CoreFoundation.framework/Headers/CoreFoundation.h:92,10 - Fatal - 'CoreFoundation/CFUserNotification.h' file not found
> 
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub.
>
